Description: The frame in which the localization occurred, starting with zero for the first frame.
The subpixel x coordinate in camera pixels
The subpixel y coordinate in camera pixels
The total number of detected photons from this event, not including background or camera offset
The Point Spread Function width in camera pixels
The Point Spread Function height in camera pixels
The number of background photons per pixel, not including the camera offset
The localization precision in x direction, in camera pixels, as estimated by the Cramer-Rao Lower Bound of the Maximum Likelihood fit.
The localization precision in y direction, in camera pixels, as estimated by the Cramer-Rao Lower Bound of the Maximum Likelihood fit.
The net gradient of this spot which is defined by the sum of gradient vector magnitudes within the fix box, projected to the spot center.
The number of iterations of the fit procedure
(Optional) An identifier to assign multiple localizations to groups, for example by picking regions of interest
(Optional) The length of the event, if localizations from consecutive frames have been linked
(Optional) The number of localizations in this event, if localizations from consecutive frames have been linked, potentially diverging from the “len” column due to a transient dark time tolerance
(Optional) The mean number of photons per frame, if localizations from consecutive frames have been linked. The total number of photons is set in the “photons” column.
